sequence_generation Package¶

orthogonal_sequences Module¶

Generates a set of orthogonal DNA sequences for a given protein sequence Currently limited by the size of the protein sequence - ~10 residues max To increase size, need to optimize search method and take steps to reduce memory usage (write to files and iterate/queue)

class pymbt.sequence_generation.orthogonal_sequences.OrthoSeq(prot_seq, T=50, min_score=0.95, n_attempt=100000.0)[source]¶

Class to calculate, store, and write orthogonality-optimized peptide sequences.

Parameters:
  • prot_seq (str.) – Input protein sequence.
  • T (float.) – Temperature at which to evaluate for orthogonality.
  • min_score – Score setpoint - stop optimization once this score

has been reched. :type min_score: float. :param n_attempt: Attempt timeout - sets maximum number of times to attempt optimization without seeing an improvement in score.

log(loop_count, n_attempted, mean_score, min_score, met, timer, oligo_list)[source]¶

Provides data trail and allows resuming/passing along an extended attempt.

Parameters:
  • loop_count (int.) – Current loop number.
  • n_attempted – Number of times optimization has been consecutively

attempted without improving the score. :type n_attempted: int. :param mean_score: Mean of the unboundedness score. :type mean_score: float. :param min_score: Min of the unboundedness score. :type min_score: float. :param met: Number of oligos that have met the score threshold. :type met: int. :param timer: Length of time for the calculation so far in seconds. :type timer: float. :param oligo_list: List of the current best oligos. :type oligo_list: list.

start(n, m=0, resume=False, wholemat=False, report=True, weighted=True, freq_threshold=0.5)[source]¶

Start the optimization.

Parameters:
  • n (int.) – The final number of orthogonal sequences to output.
  • m (int.) – The number of new sequences to try out on each iteration.
  • resume – A path to a dir from a previous run, and will

cause start() to pick up where it left off. :type resume: str. :param wholemat: if True, m worst oligos are thrown out on each iteration. if False, single best is kept. There is a difference but it should be better documented. :type wholemat: bool. :param weighted: Determines whether codons generated should be weighted (codon-optimized). :type weighted: bool. :param freq_threshold: relative frequency threshold below which codons should not be used. Enables avoidance of very rare codons (codon optimization). :type freq_threshold: float.

pymbt.sequence_generation.orthogonal_sequences.remove_redundant(seq_list, oligo_params)[source]¶

Removes and regenerates sequences that appear more than once in a list.

Parameters:
  • seq_list (str.) – Sequences.
  • oligo_params (tuple.) – parameters to be passed to _gen_oligo.
pymbt.sequence_generation.orthogonal_sequences.unflatten(input_list, n)[source]¶

Given a flat list, makes a new list of n-length lists out of it, in order.

Parameters:
  • input_list (list.) – List to flatten.
  • n (int.) – Group size.

Provides a generator class for random DNA or RNA sequence

Parameters:n (int.) – Output sequence length.
generate()[source]¶

Generate the sequence.

random_codons Module¶

class pymbt.sequence_generation.random_codons.RandomCodons(sequence, material='pep', freq_table='sc', threshold=0.0)[source]¶

Generator class for random DNA or RNA sequence.

Parameters:
  • sequence (str.) – Sequence for which to generate randomized codons.
  • material (str.) – ‘dna’ for DNA or ‘pep’ for amino acid sequence.
generate()[source]¶

Generate the sequence.

weighted_codons Module¶

class pymbt.sequence_generation.weighted_codons.WeightedCodons(sequence, frequency_table='sc', material='pep')[source]¶

Provides a generator class for random, weighted DNA or RNA sequences.

Parameters:
  • sequence (str.) – Input sequence.
  • frequency_table (dict.) – The codon frequency dictionary to use.
  • material – ‘dna’ for DNA or ‘pep’ for amino acid sequence

(default). :type material: str.

generate()[source]¶

Generate the sequence.

weighted(pep)[source]¶

Take an amino acid, select a codon at random, weighted by frequency.
